intro: Uvaria poggei var. anisotricha, commonly known as the variable uvaria, is a species of flowering plant in the Anacardiaceae family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in lowland tropical forests. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that may be edible, though its flavor and nutritional value are not well documented.
